book.title: The Diary of a Young Girl

review.body: Diary of a Young Girl by Anne Frank was an interesting book. It was interesting seeing a 14 year old girl perspective and saying about what she was going through. At parts this book was scary to read like the part when she was talking about how kids were left without parents, people were being ta...

This is a book that pulls you in and never lets you go. The story captivated me from the very beginning and just kept getting better as it went on. The character depth was outstanding. These are characters that you easily fall in love with and become so involved with their story.

I love my rocker...

book.title: The Treasure Principle: Unlocking the Secret of Joyful Giving

review.body: Very convicting. Need to realize the importance of giving.
m

This does not conclude the story of MacBeth, bu it does conclude the story for the witches three. And it's done brilliantly. Maybe a little too nicely tidied up at the end, or it felt rushed after all of the animosity, but it worked and was well done so it's only a mild complaint.
4.5 stars
Love anything by the Judy!
I want to read more. I learned so much about life in London and while there was some intense medical scenes, I enjoyed it thoroughly. The next book is waiting at the library for me.

However, I ended up loving this book, for a multitude of reasons. Angel/Aiden is a realist - in order to do what he needs done, he must do what he mig...

Great Book!

As someone who helped raised my younger siblings while still young I could relate to Julian. I love his and Emma's relationship and the entire Blackthorn clan. I can't wait for the next book.
7 stars!

book.title: Bluegrass Seduction (The Bluegrass Billionaire Trilogy Book 1)

review.body: Auggie is privileged and the daughter of a wealthy equine family in Kentucky. Her mother is set on running Auggie's life for her, even though she is old enough to do for herself and graduated college. Bent on embarrassing his father, Worthington LaViere III uses his position as a highly respected...

book.title: Facade: A Modern Romance Inspired by The Phantom of The Opera

review.body: Facade by Kim Carmichael is a first time read for me. I wasn't sure what to expect in this story as I jumped into reading it with no knowledge of what it would be about. It took me awhile to get into the book. When I start reading a book it has to grab my attention right away. I loved how this st...

book.title: Everyday Pilates: Up, Up and Away

review.body:
Quick Workout

I use this workout on days I haven't moved enough. It's succinct, works up a sweat, and I feel better. The videos and accompanying text is easy to follow and works all the major muscle groups without flowy talk. I'm in and out and a little sore tomorrow.
3.5 Stars
